title: Formulation of PLGA nanoparticles for intracellular delivery of protein drug

author: Mateja Cegnar, Faculty of Pharmacy, University of Ljubljana

segmentation: So thank you for the introduction.
In my presentation.
I would like to point out the use of nanoscale carriers.
This can help us to deliver protein drug inside the cells.

So first I would like to speak about our model protein drugs starting then proteins.

Therefore suitable formulation is necessary.
I will focus on nanoparticles.

I will present our production of nanoparticles with this protein drugs, starting with regard to mechanism of nanoparticles formation and how technological parameters affects the particle size, an protein stability.
And finally how we tested our system with regard to delivery and efficiency.

China particles.
So just starting it was isolated from chicken egg white.
It is a protein of 115 army receipt residues.
According to its biological function, it is inhibitor of sustain protein, as is more precisely extracellular inhibitor.
And to sympathizers are very important enzymes that are involved in metastasis process, especially in case where where they have excessive proteolytic activity.
But this proteolysis take place not only extracellularly but also intracellularly.

But for intracellular delivery.
We therefore need a suitable delivery system.
To carry our protein rack inside the cells and we chose to develop nanoparticle sweet.

They have labeled through dimensional confirmation that can easily be broken down and proteins has very short circulation lifetime becausw of rapid and semantic degradation and other extreme conditions such as PA, channel similarity and so on.
And those are molecules are also very hydrophilic, enlarge and can therefore hardly penetrate through lipid biological membranes.
So therefore we need a suitable delivery system.
And how can we overcome all those problems well?

One alternative is that too we develop a suitable formulation by that mean that we can physically entrap the protein into an art material and such carrier system can therefore protect the drugs from premature degradation.
Can also release the drug with various kinetics or can ever direct drug to specific site of the body.
And we chose nanoparticles.
Now, uh, WHI nanoscale carriers where first of all size is 1 very important parameter that plays a key role in bio distribution profile of the system in the body.

Nano size carriers interact differently with biological system as compared to other larger system, because with nano sized particles we are reaching the size of biological macromolecules and this is the scale where basic biological processes take place and nanoparticles can penetrate deeper into the tissue.
Also are taken up by different cells and targeting can be also achieved by active or passive.

Targeting active targeting means that we attach specifically guns or antibodies on the nanoparticle surface, and such system can then recognize enrich specific target, but passive targeting exploits the difference between normal and healthy healthy tissue, as it was observed for the tumor.
Tissue here is also the schematic presentation of passive targeting and passive targeting exploits.
The difference between.

I already said between normal and tumor tissue and very important difference is that normal vessels has very tight and Italian, but tumor vessels has disorganized and leaky and Italian, which is also necessary for rapid nutrient supply for the tumor growth.
But this weakness, on the other hand, enables the extravasation of small sized particles if they are applied intravenously.

So this phenomenon has been called enhanced permission and retention effect, showing that nanoparticles are so small that they can extrapolate from the tumor vessel into the surrounding tumor tissue and also accumulates in this area.

According to this emergent method.

It is necessary that organic solvent has some solubility of water.

In water, organic solvent therefore diffuses in the continuous aqueous phase, leaving the polymer in water, and since the polymer is not soluble in water, it precipitates in the form of nanoparticles.

So aqueous solution of protein was added to the polymer inorganic phase.
By steering, we obtain the emergent system which was then stabilized by the aqueous solution of Poly vinyl alcohol.
This year that sort of double emergent system.
That was then diluted with water, but that will facilitate this.
This diffusion of organic solvent water.
And then finally, polymer precipitate in the form of nanoparticles, incorporating the protein.

Imagine system, but it does require high energy input.
